Perform a Chi-square (*X*<sup>2</sup>) test for the data presented in
the table. What is the correct conclusion with Î± = 0.05?

Answerlist
----------
* There is a statistical association between income and satisfaction,
  because the observed *X*<sup>2</sup> is smaller than the critical
  *X*<sup>2</sup>.
* There is no statistical association between income and satisfaction,
  because the observed *X*<sup>2</sup> is smaller than the critical
  *X*<sup>2</sup>.
* There is a statistical association between income and satisfaction,
  because the observed *X*<sup>2</sup> is greater than the critical
  *X*<sup>2</sup>.
* There is no statistical association between income and satisfaction,
  because the observed *X*<sup>2</sup> is greater than the critical
  *X*<sup>2</sup>.
